quest.name: To Siege or Not to Siege
journal: Alphinaud is distracted by a call on his linkpearl.

Tataru sends grave tidings from the Holy See. It would seem the Horde gathers once more to renew its assault upon the city. Return to Ishgard, and rendezvous with the receptionist outside Fortemps Manor.
After welcoming you back to Ishgard, Tataru bids you enter Fortemps Manor, where Lord Haurchefant and Count Edmont wait to discuss the looming threat.

Your Ishgardian allies confirm that a Dravanian invasion is indeed imminent. Concerned for your safety, the count urges you to consider seeking sanctuary elsewhere. Speak with Alphinaud, and decide what the Scions will do.

After discussing the matter with Alphinaud, you resolve to do all in your power to aid your friends and allies. Faced with the assembled might of the Horde, however, how can the Holy See's exhausted defenders hope to prevail...?
objectives: Speak with Tataru outside Fortemps Manor.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Tataru? ...Yes, General Raubahn is now in safe hands.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What? ...Another assault? Very well. We shall return at once. Pray notify the count of our coming.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It would seem we face another crisis. The Dravanians are preparing to resume their siege of the Holy See.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Though I am loath to abandon the sultana to her fate, we lack the necessary evidence to act upon Dewlala's claims.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That being the case, I propose we leave Marshal Tarupin and the others to investigate, and return with all haste to Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are! Sorry for cutting your reunion with General Raubahn short.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I wouldn't have bothered you, but the city's awash with rumors of another Dravanian attack, and Lord Haurchefant was desperate to get hold of you. Speaking of whom, he and the others are waiting for you inside, so you'd better head in!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We can talk later! Everyone's waiting for you inside!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us hear what the count has to say.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: I believe Mistress Tataru wished a word with you. Pray do not take long, however, as we have much to discuss.

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned...

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: The hour has come...

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: There you are, old girlboy! Tell me, do you want the good news first or the bad news? Actually, don't bother. There isn't any good news.

dialogue.name: PIPPIN
dialogue.text: Pray do not tarry for my father's sake. I will see that he is well looked after. And should we uncover any information on Her Grace's whereabouts, I promise you will be the first to know.

dialogue.name: DEWLALA
dialogue.text: I have taken charge of matters here. Consider yourself free to tend to other, more pressing tasks.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: My friend! I thank you for answering our call with such alacrity! As I am sure you are now aware, the Dravanians are once more gathering for war.

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname, Master Leveilleur─I must apologize for this abrupt summons, but we thought it best to have Mistress Tataru contact you by the most direct means available.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: When the Observatorium's bells toll, 'tis a warning that cannot be ignored. The Holy See has ordered that we make ready for battle.

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: In case you haven't heard, a band of trappers returning from the west claim they saw a cloud of dragons big enough to dim the midday sky!

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Nidhogg's minions gather once more for war...

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: But I would not have you take up arms in another of our conflicts. When first you came to Ishgard, I offered you my protection. If I cannot ensure your safety here, I cannot well accept your aid, much less ask for it.

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Scions of the Seventh Dawn, you are faced with a choice: to remain in a besieged Ishgard, or seek sanctuary elsewhere. I would not presume to influence your decision, but I must ask that you make it swiftly, lest our enemies force your hand.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: The coming of the Horde spells ruin for Ishgard...but her knights shall fight to the last to shield her citizens from harm!

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: I confess, I know not where else you might seek sanctuary, but few places are like to be more perilous than a city under siege.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: The Observatorium bells have tolled. Either flee this place or make ready for war.

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: How many dragons would it take to darken the midday sky, do you think? A thousand? More? Too many, at any rate...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though we flee to the ends of the world, 'twould seem that no place in this troubled age is free of strife. Once more the Horde descends upon Ishgard, and once more her weary defenders must take up spear and bow.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The count would have us seek shelter from this storm, but I, for one, grow tired of running. If we are to shine the light of dawn, we must do so in the sight of our fellow man, not hunkered in a hole.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What say you, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What say you?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I would stay and fight.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We cannot stay here.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Hmph.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then fight we shall! Let it never be said that we abandoned our allies in their hour of need!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...That is your answer? By the Twelve, how could you─ But, wait. Mayhap remaining in the city would not best serve our friends and allies. Mayhap there is another choice...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Thank you for rescuing General Raubahn. From the bottom of my heart. To behold him now, gaunt and unkempt... It pains me to think of all the hardship he has endured.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: From the bottom of my heart, thank you for rescuing General Raubahn.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: What will become of this place...and us?
